title: (x) Classic looking leaf ornaments - Adobe Minion {Yves}
author: Michael Hernan

comments.content: Damn -- wrong Slimbach face! I started with Adobe Garamond...

LOL. How about that? I didn't know it would be that simple, I thought I had photocopied from some rare esoteric manuscript!

Hmm....

Actually the bottom right ornament with the hanging double leaf is not in the Minion characterset so I wonder of the origin before adopted by Minion.

You don't get off that easy!

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140512025830im_/http:/typophile.com/files/minion_3595.png)

Hm? They are all in there …

The very last on YOUR sample is simply cut off.

I am surprised @Renko you are satisfied that it is there because of a buggy white space?

The last form is not in Minion Pro which suggests I have stumbled across the source for these. If everyone is satisfied in just identifying the font [x] [MinionPro] that uses all but one of the forms above - that's OK [well done], but I also am interested in what the actual source is without having to actually ask Robert Slimbach directly.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140512025830im_/http:/typophile.com/files/floral2_4423.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140512025830im_/http:/typophile.com/files/minion_4873.png)

I see it now (in your example) and am totally embarrassed.

I withdraw my 'slander' and humbly appologise.

Great work... [blush]
\*smiles\* You are welcome, Michael. We simply forget the last posts, okay? ;^D
It is safe to trust Rainer -- he is seldom wrong. ;^)
Now you make me blush, sir. Thanks, Yves.
